content.prompt: Considering global trends in late-nineteenth-century migration movements, the Indian migrations to the Caribbean that produced the demographic situation shown in the table most likely led to which of the following short-term effects?

choices.label: The emergence of new Hindu-Christian syncretic religions
The creation of Indian ethnic enclaves in Caribbean societies
The expansion of the Indo-Caribbean middle class
The growing popularity of socialism among Indian migrants to the Caribbean

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
